column1: The Biden-Harris administration's priorities are COVID-19 economic recovery racial equality and climate change. It's a justice agenda and I'm ready to get to work. https://t.co/5j58fJBMJ3
The time is now for aggressive action on the coronavirus and climate crisis. The age of incrementalism is over. The era of the Green New Deal is here. #BidenBeBrave  https://t.co/Ys78fK6LCo

This is the COVID infection rate in Massachusetts. It's as bad as last spring. Take no chances. Stay home avoid all indoor gatherings and if you have to go outside wear a mask. https://t.co/3euCbhdtPz

The virus is spreading as rapidly as ever. We need COVID relief and we need it now. $2000/month per person. Student loan forgiveness. Home internet for all. Workplace protections for essential workers. And funding to keep cities and towns from driving off a financial cliff.
The pandemic is far from over. Harvard needs to do the right and just thing and extend COVID-19 worker protections for contracted staff. https://t.co/7wlxBkyBKD

President-elect Biden has a mandate to lead the fight for racial economic and environmental justice and deliver a just recovery for a country ravaged by the COVID-19 pandemic. I am excited to work alongside his administration and to push for the bold and urgent action we need.
Donald Trump knew how dangerous COVID-19 was in January. He warned his billionaire friends but refused to tell the American people. He has blood on his hands.
Donald Trump allowed the Pentagon to funnel $1 billion in funding for COVID relief and PPE to defense contractors.

We don’t have to listen to Trump’s lies on the debate stage we can look at his presidency in the numbers: 223000 COVID-19 deaths. 8 million COVID-19 cases. 22 million jobs lost. 7 million more people without health insurance. Trump is a failure and he knows it.

Donald Trump recovered from COVID-19 by using taxpayer money to get the finest health care in the world.   Yet for the last 4 years he’s worked to undermine the ACA and deny health coverage to millions.  Trump is a selfish hypocrite with no value for human life except his own.

While over 200000 Americans died Mitch McConnell didn’t lift a finger to pass another COVID relief bill. Instead he’s forcing a confirmation hearing for Trump’s illegitimate Supreme Court nominee. It’s disgraceful but not surprising.
Donald Trump is criminally negligent in the COVID-19 deaths of over 200000 Americans. We will vote out his corrupt administration in November and recover from this pandemic with justice. #MASen

Donald Trump and the Republican party have failed to follow social distancing guidelines. They deny science. They don't seem to care at all about public health and safety. Why should we trust them to lead our country's COVID-19 response? #MASen

COVID-19 cases are rising in Massachusetts. We have a responsibility to be vigilant and protect ourselves our friends and our neighbors from this deadly virus. Wear your mask when you go outside practice social distancing and get tested if you feel sick.

I was tested for the coronavirus today and am happy to report that I tested negative. Please protect those around you and wear a mask. If you think you may have been exposed to the virus get tested as soon as possible and isolate yourself from others. https://t.co/ROl4t1TKJp

Over 200000 Americans have died from COVID-19. Many were turned away from hospitals and told only to come back when they could not breathe.  Now politicians are checking into hospitals as a “precaution.”  Health care should be a right not a privilege. We need Medicare for All.

The United States Postal Service is crucial to our communities and our democracy. We joined @RepRichardNeal @EricLesser @TalbertSwan and postal workers in Springfield to demand $25 billion for the USPS in our next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/jqzjQUmH26

We are facing an unprecedented crisis. 200000 Americans have died. But while millions of workers—including medical professionals—risked their lives without the PPE they needed to stay safe the Pentagon funneled nearly $1B in COVID-relief funds to wealthy defense contractors. https://t.co/LkAjJDD4lU

The USPS was preparing to send every family in America the masks they need to protect themselves. This plan would have significantly slowed the spread of the coronavirus and saved thousands of lives. Donald Trump is complicit in the death and devastation of this pandemic. https://t.co/MHvgT7yZ38
In March @ewarren and I demanded that Trump’s White House publish their COVID-19 testing plan and make all testing accessible widespread and free. They did not comply.
In January I called on President Trump to appoint a Global Health Chief to coordinate an international response to the potential coronavirus pandemic. Trump did not listen.

Trump has known about the danger and severity of the coronavirus pandemic since the beginning of this year. We urged him to use his presidential authority to protect our country. He chose to lie delay and downplay the crisis.

Donald Trump is personally responsible for killing countless Americans. He lied about the dangers of the coronavirus for months despite admitting on tape that he knew it was a highly contagious and deadly disease. Defeating him in November is a matter of life and death.

With classes and homework remote internet access isn’t a luxury it’s a necessity. That’s why I’m fighting for $4 billion in our next COVID-19 relief package to guarantee high-speed reliable internet to every student across our country.

Resident physicians at @CHalliance are caring for patients and risking their lives on the frontline of COVID-19. I stand with @cirseiu members in the fight for a fair contract that guarantees them the stability and respect which they deserve. https://t.co/UOPyC953Va

We know why BIPOC have been disproportionately affected by COVID-19: generations of social economic and climate disenfranchisement. It is not enough to just provide relief and testing now. We need bold systemic change to rectify these disparities and bring long-lasting relief. https://t.co/ipJyacjKcn

We cannot separate the devastating impact of the coronavirus pandemic from the centuries of systemic injustices forced on communities of color. We need to take bold and urgent action now to rectify environmental racism and give our communities the justice and relief they deserve. https://t.co/eCbvC8KhrJ

The COVID-19 infection rate in East Boston is now 11% the highest of any neighborhood in the city. We must stand together as a community to care for each other during this crisis and fight for a just recovery that puts communities like East Boston at the front of the line. https://t.co/f81rM4699a

Residents of Chelsea know all too well the impacts of environmental racism. The city faces the highest rate of COVID-19 in the state and worst air pollution in the region. We are fighting to end these inequities and guarantee social racial and environmental justice for all. https://t.co/fRPhOIOLEz

COVID-19 cases are rising in Massachusetts and across the country. For the safety of voters and our organizers our campaign is not knocking doors to get out the vote. Instead you can sign up to make calls and organize with us safely at https://t.co/cXJWf14gL9. https://t.co/dqkagKSWit

Chelsea Massachusetts has long suffered from oppressive air pollution and now faces the highest rate of COVID-19 in the state. @AyannaPressley and I successfully fought to install air quality monitors in the city so we can finally deliver on the promise of environmental justice. https://t.co/OMa789viTd

Every family needs an internet connection. That's why I'm fighting in the Senate to expand my E-Rate program in the COVID relief bill and make sure every student can connect to class from home. https://t.co/Ir8EhaGaZC

The rental crisis is not new. Nearly half of all renter households were struggling with payments before the coronavirus pandemic.   We need long-term permanent solutions to provide affordable housing.  We need a Green New Deal for public housing.
Communities of color face higher levels of air pollution higher rates of asthma and now higher incidences of COVID-19. None of this is a coincidence. https://t.co/tfjh9QaYPk

Nearly 160000 Americans have died from COVID-19. Donald Trump is criminally negligent in his handling of this crisis and responsible for the deaths suffering and unprecedented economic crisis that is crushing families across our country. https://t.co/PpD6tGw2Nv

We have an obligation to protect working people especially those whose livelihoods have been devastated by this crisis. Today I’m in Washington to fight for $500 million in fisheries disaster relief in the next COVID-19 package.

As COVID-19 surges medical deferred action is more important than ever. That’s why in April following reports that the Trump administration was again refusing deferred action applications @ewarren and I demanded justice for patients denied or ignored by our immigration system.

Survivors of the coronavirus show symptoms of ME/CFS a debilitating and chronic illness that already impacts 2.5 million Americans. I am fighting to secure the funding needed to treat this disease and give patients the care they need. https://t.co/JzdlIM5Yyb

ME/CFS is a chronic illness affecting 2.5 million Americans. There is no treatment and survivors of COVID-19 are showing symptoms of this debilitating disease. Join us live tomorrow and hear about our fight to secure $15 million in annual research funding for ME/CFS. https://t.co/SHAjKlWoMW

The live events industry was one of the first and hardest hit by the COVID-19 pandemic. I stand in solidarity with the Live Events Coalition demanding urgent relief and expanded unemployment for all workers including self-employed gig and contract workers. https://t.co/ogC3FV9NPU

COVID-19 has changed health care in America forever and community health centers have taken on emormous new responsibilities. It is my priority to ensure that the Greater New Bedford Community Health Center has all the resources and help it needs to weather this crisis. https://t.co/ePyVuNXCHE

Chelsea has the highest rate of COVID-19 infections in the state and is one of the most polluted cities in the region. That's no coincidence—that's environmental racism. @AyannaPressley and I are partnering to rectify this injustice and install air quality monitors in Chelsea. https://t.co/DMJ7UWIAUh

The health and safety of millions of Americans is at risk as the coronavirus surges in states across the country. We need true impartial and trustworthy information from the federal government. We must protect Dr. Fauci. https://t.co/XdW6RWGFRX

Gladys Vega and @la_colaborativa have provided 11000 meals a week in Chelsea since the coronavirus pandemic hit. Please support their important work distributing groceries and essential goods like diapers to families in the worst hit city in Massachusetts.https://t.co/7j6EGu9DGP https://t.co/LPszu0rcMS

Donald Trump still insists that the coronavirus will just “disappear” but the truth is that it won’t and neither will the economic crisis that the pandemic has brought on. That’s why I’m fighting for the Heroes Act in the Senate to provide immediate relief to our communities.

The Green New Deal is about jobs and it’s about justice.   We can unleash a clean energy revolution that will create millions of new good-paying union jobs.   And we can do it while centering communities of color hardest hit by the climate crisis and the coronavirus pandemic.

Stop and Shop has ended hazard pay even though our country saw more new daily COVID-19 cases last week than ever before.  This is unacceptable and an insult to these workers.  That's why I stood with UFCW 1445 yesterday to demand management give them the hazard pay they deserve. https://t.co/iDtKTXJUsp

Our veterans deserve better. We must conduct a rigorous investigation into the COVID-19 outbreak at the Chelsea Soldiers’ Home and ensure that a tragedy like this never happens again. https://t.co/f3wTJ2d6UI

Opening immigration courts now will force our immigrant communities to choose between fear of deportation and fear of COVID-19. This is reckless cruel and puts our communities at risk. We cannot allow this to happen.  https://t.co/zo8d5VL5uN

The COVID-19 pandemic is not going away and in many places is getting worse. A single $1200 check was nowhere near enough to protect Americans during this unprecedented crisis. That's why @KamalaHarris @BernieSanders and I are calling for monthly payments of $2000 per person.

Join us live for a benefit concert in support of the Boston Black Hospitality Coalition and help Black-owned businesses that have been badly impacted by COVID-19. Make a donation now at https://t.co/HgyQOUY1RO. #BlackOwnedBoston https://t.co/EfNk46H96u

Environmental justice is health justice. Chelsea has suffered the highest rate of COVID-19 infection of any community in Massachusetts. We must guarantee clean air for all and aggressively hold industries accountable for polluting our communities.  https://t.co/KkRR3Av4Ri

Trump admitted yesterday to slowing the government’s response to the coronavirus when he should have been urgently accelerating testing and the production of PPE.  More than 122000 Americans have died of COVID-19.  This president must be held accountable for criminal negligence.

Trump’s continued effort to demonize and deport immigrants undermines our values as Americans and worsens the coronavirus pandemic.   We must stop deportations and welcome asylum seekers.  That is why I am filing the Immigration Enforcement Moratorium Act today.

COVID-19 cases are surging in states that have reopened without proper precautions. We need PPE contact tracing and direct relief. And we must fight harder than ever for Medicare for All so that all people in our country can get the care they need without worrying about cost.

The Trump administration is failing America by ignoring President Obama's pandemic response strategy. Join me and @RonaldKlain President Obama's Ebola czar as we discuss a more effective COVID-19 response. https://t.co/tICcodx2ep

Trump ignored President Obama's pandemic response strategy. Today more than 117000 Americans have died and millions are out of work. Join me and @RonaldKlain as we discuss the Obama Administration's response to the Ebola crisis and a more effective COVID-19 response. https://t.co/VhaXgYi34k

Nearly all @UNITEHERE26 workers have been laid off during this pandemic. Many have died from COVID-19 or lost family members. I am standing with Local 26 members this morning to demand that we urgently expand coronavirus relief. https://t.co/IujDOBMmcd

I was a commuter to college and law school and drove an ice cream truck to pay tuition. I did not pay off all my loans until I’d been in Congress for 6 years. That’s why I’m fighting for immediate student debt relief in the next coronavirus response package.

Trump ignored President Obama's pandemic response strategy. Today more than 100000 Americans are dead and millions are out of work. Join me and @RonaldKlain as we discuss the Obama Administration's response to the Ebola crisis and a more effective COVID-19 response. https://t.co/jpWOlCogYj

I've fought back against the impact of COVID-19 on behalf of Western Massachusetts securing $1.43 million in funding for Springfield $92000 for Chicopee $69000 for Pittsfield and millions more across the state in relief funding. #MASen

In our words and actions let us honor all those lost in service to our country our veterans who are especially vulnerable to the coronavirus and their families on this #MemorialDay. https://t.co/44WXDuQNhi

Veterans' nursing homes have been devastated by COVID-19. We must have oversight provide testing and care for veterans who are homeless and honor those we have lost. Join us live with @SenatorMikeRush and @rep_campbell. #MemorialDay https://t.co/MAJlKCZfiR

This Memorial Day we have a new responsibility to honor service members lost to the coronavirus pandemic. Please join @SenatorMikeRush @rep_campbell and me this afternoon for a discussion on what we are doing to support veterans and their families. https://t.co/AqRpkbb1Ax
Anyone in Malden can get tested for the coronavirus for free.   https://t.co/Ph5FXNlzXp

Over the last nine weeks Massachusetts has lost over 6000 people to COVID-19. This is unacceptable. We need to provide PPE to all workers guarantee free and widespread testing and provide treatment at no cost in order to stop the spread and prevent further deaths and tragedy.

Únete a mí @jossievalentin y al Rep. Carlos González ahora mientras hablamos del impacto de la pandemia COVID-19 en la comunidad puertorriqueña de Massachusetts y en la isla y discutimos lo que estamos haciendo para proporcionar apoyo. https://t.co/NJ52GQfwzt

Join me @jossievalentin and State Rep. Carlos Gonzalez now as we talk about the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Puerto Rican community in Massachusetts and on the island and what we're doing to provide support. https://t.co/4nLbm9YBdl

La comunidad puertorriqueña enfrenta retos únicos durante esta crisis. Sintoniza esta noche para un conversatorio conmigo el representante estatal Carlos González y @JossieValentin sobre el impacto del COVID-19 en las comunidades puertorriqueñas del oeste de MA y en la isla. https://t.co/OUIcld9RUi

History will remember Andrew Wheeler for the environmental injustice he perpetrated in the name of the EPA harming the health of the most vulnerable people in our country as their communities are devastated by the coronavirus. https://t.co/fUPpQW6dsu

The Puerto Rican community is facing unique challenges during this crisis. Join me State Rep. Carlos Gonzalez and @JossieValentin to discuss the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Puerto Rican communities in Western MA and on the island. https://t.co/QSQKbJ99W6

It is dangerous and irresponsible that ICE planned to deport people to Haiti who had tested positive for the coronavirus. Deportations to Haiti and all deportations must immediately end.  https://t.co/BS1Xw2MJfI

Systemic environmental racism has plagued frontline communities like Chelsea for decades. Now residents are dying from COVID-19 at disproportionate rates. Join me and @GreenRootsEJ today for a forum on environmental justice. https://t.co/mCJrFeT8xN
Tune in to the latest #MarkeyOnTheMic to hear @SamuelJHyun discuss the rise in anti-Asian racism during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/acY5VBdj8O

During the chaos of the COVID-19 pandemic the Trump Administration has tried to create insecure health data networks that are prone to abuse. Even in a crisis we must stay vigilant against those who see an opportunity to take away our fundamental rights. https://t.co/BGpfuE1v93
Join @MayorArrigo and me live as we discuss how the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted Revere and what the federal government can do to provide urgently needed relief. https://t.co/lkQrA0FTfZ

We will not allow Donald Trump to leave any of our communities behind. Join me and Revere @MayorArrigo tonight to discuss how COVID-19 is impacting Revere and what the city needs from the federal government. https://t.co/lHzdZZyrAE

The majority of all COVID-19 infections are tied to nursing homes and long-term care facilities. We must act urgently to prevent further tragedy. Join me and @LoriTrahanMA today to demand resources and oversight to keep nursing home workers and patients safe. https://t.co/zKD1NIeUkK

A strong body of research shows that long-term illnesses like ME/CFS can be triggered by viruses like COVID-19. We need to be prepared for what comes next and start care immediately. #MillionsMissing https://t.co/kyvmBy3ngC
Now is the moment to mobilize a national service program that will put hundreds of thousands to work strengthening the frontline response to COVID-19. https://t.co/U0jOYO4SwP

Contracting the coronavirus can be the equivalent of a death sentence for people who are incarcerated. That is unacceptable. We must protect those in prison and expand compassionate release. #AnswerTheirCall https://t.co/bTmIOJ3wU6

We must make all available data public immediately and use all tools at our disposal to understand the impact of COVID-19 on communities of color. This data will help us save lives and protect the most vulnerable communities in our society.

That’s why @ewarren @ayannapressley and I have joined together on legislation to force the Department of Health and Human Services to release racial and other demographic data on coronavirus patients.

Chelsea home to a vibrant immigrant community is at the heart of the coronavirus crisis in Massachusetts. The reported rate of infection is 5958 per 100000 residents over four times the statewide average.
Black Americans account for only 13% of the population but represent a third of all deaths from COVID-19. They are being killed at nearly three times the rate as other demographic groups.
The coronavirus crisis is exposing and exacerbating the racism and injustice embedded in our economy and our health care system.
The coronavirus crisis has disproportionately impacted people of color and low-income and working class communities. Chelsea is a prime example of this disparity.

Chelsea is a diverse working class city with a strong immigrant community.  Today it is the epicenter of the coronavirus crisis in Massachusetts.   The community needs our help. https://t.co/WEnKy1dXuw

More than 74000 Americans have died from the coronavirus. It is projected we will soon lose 3000 people every day. Donald Trump has failed to protect our country and he must be held accountable. https://t.co/ZV8o2vagma

I am live tonight with @VictoriaNewcomb and Dr. Claire McCarthy to talk about the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on children and families and strategies to manage mental health during this crisis. https://t.co/1q08dyWiwG

The COVID-19 pandemic is taking a toll on the mental health of our children families and communities. Join us tonight for a discussion on how to manage mental health during this crisis. https://t.co/re5qEUjv5h

All workers at small businesses are being impacted by the COVID-19 crisis including those at state-legal marijuana dispensaries. We cannot leave anyone behind. That’s why we’re calling on Congressional leadership to allow small cannabis businesses to receive aid from the SBA. https://t.co/y7YUxzLXBP

Postal workers deliver the mail come rain snow or COVID-19. They connect all of us. Now Trump is threatening their very future. Join me and John Flattery today as we demand action to save the Postal Service. https://t.co/WHW1tLRBkn

This pandemic has exposed the inequity and injustice that has plagued communities of color for decades.   We must have justice for frontline communities and take bold and urgent action to protect families essential workers and all people who are at high-risk of the coronavirus.

Of the other 5 COVID-19 hotspots in Massachusetts—Brockton Everett Lynn Randolph and Lawrence—all are state designated “environmental justice” communities with high percentages of minority & low-income residents and high rates of respiratory diseases. https://t.co/7S7Gng5LhB

We see this in Chelsea where 2157 people have been infected and 107 have died from COVID-19 so far. The city is one of the communities hardest hit by the pandemic—and by industrial pollution. https://t.co/S7xLzNFdXe
These same chronic illnesses that disproportionately affect communities of color contribute to increased rates of mortality from COVID-19.

Cranberries are a beloved staple of the Massachusetts economy and integral to more than seven thousand jobs. Now due to the coronavirus crisis and tariffs growers are facing dire financial stress. That’s why we’re calling for the USDA to provide relief. https://t.co/Mayp7piuJC

Our domestic seafood industry has been devastated by COVID-19. It is time for the Trump Administration to take responsibility. We are calling for the USDA to protect seafood producers in Massachusetts and along the coast.  https://t.co/RCPUjxnYyW

I am on a virtual #WalkforHunger this morning to support @ProjectBread and every family facing food insecurity during COVID-19. Please join me and make a donation at https://t.co/yEKoc9mDj5. #MakeHungerHistory. https://t.co/9rcZBBFn6C

Communities of color are disproportionately affected by the COVID-19 pandemic so why aren’t Pence and the CDC taking action? I am joining @ewarren and @ayannapressley in demanding answers. https://t.co/7R3U2a1790

The disability community needs relief protection and our support. Join @mattbc @RebeccaCokley and me live now to talk about how we will ensure that the needs of people with disabilities are prioritized in the next coronavirus relief bill. https://t.co/fP0WyRvT15

That’s why I am fighting for a #PeoplesBailout to put workers and families first in our coronavirus relief.   And it's why the Green New Deal is not just about environmental justice it’s also about jobs. Good paying union jobs.

Our campaign had 7000 signatures before COVID-19. We needed 10000 to get on the ballot. So we asked our supporters to send us their signatures by mail and we received more than 23000. https://t.co/iOv5YYGUWj
On the mic with me in the latest episode of our podcast is Dr. Walter Willett. Tune in to listen to his advice on best food safety practices during COVID-19. https://t.co/acY5VAVIhg

I stood with @ewarren and @ayannapressley to demand the release of racial and ethnic data for coronavirus patients weeks ago. I am once again calling on @CMSGov  to release the data. We cannot allow for more marginalized communities to bear the brunt of this crisis.

We honor all workers who have been injured made sick or killed on the job including the thousands of essential workers who have contracted COVID-19. We must hold them close to our hearts and fight to ensure that all people are safe and protected at work. #WorkersMemorialDay

COVID-19 ha expuesto las injusticias que las comunidades negras y morenas siempre han enfrentado. Necesitamos un Nuevo Pacto Verde ahora más que nunca para traer empleos y protección ambiental a ciudades como Chelsea. https://t.co/CAcEvWNEPB

COVID-19 has exposed injustices that Black and Brown communities have always endured. We need a Green New Deal now more than ever to bring jobs and environmental protection to cities like Chelsea. https://t.co/0ewGMoPEyy
We are not going to allow this president to exploit the coronavirus pandemic to undermine and attack our environmental protections. https://t.co/opaYvUMEWX?

The community in Chelsea is standing together as they face the worst of the coronavirus pandemic. Now it is up to all of us to stand with them. Make a donation to help families at the epicenter of COVID-19 in Massachusetts: https://t.co/WEnKy0WmCY. https://t.co/XIlQlEYdV0
Decarceration will save lives. Join me and @DARollins live as we address the impact of the COVID-19 crisis on the criminal justice system. https://t.co/qjEm5m3YyQ
We cannot ignore the climate crisis as we address this pandemic. @JaneFonda joined me on the mic to discuss climate change environmental justice and COVID-19. https://t.co/acY5VAVIhg

Incarcerated individuals face a huge risk of COVID-19 infections. Decarceration is critical to keep both inmates and prison workers safe. Join me and @DARollins today to talk about the impact of COVID-19 on our criminal justice system and the need for compassionate release. https://t.co/Xd5J1wAmhh

The elderly are one of the most vulnerable groups in this pandemic and nursing homes are facing the brunt of the crisis. A fifth of COVID-19 deaths have been tied to nursing homes. We must take urgent action to protect residents and workers and give them the PPE they need. https://t.co/AlTjdKeG5R

The COVID-19 crisis has shown that we are capable of rising to the occasion and making huge changes to save our communities. Now we must do the same to save our planet from the climate crisis. #EarthDay @janefonda https://t.co/kWyqFdBkMV
Air pollution makes the COVID-19 crisis worse.  Ignoring social distancing makes the COVID-19 crisis worse.  Enbridge is putting lives at risk. https://t.co/f4HVJ85qJL
The effects of the COVID-19 crisis are not felt equally. Join me and @DrMaryTBassett live now for a conversation on health inequity during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/u7ESmKqb8U

The COVID-19 pandemic is exposing huge disparities in our health care system. Join me and @DrMaryTBassett today to talk about how we can address these injustices and promote equity in our coronavirus response. https://t.co/gOui7ne4j1

I am live now with @GreenrootsEJ leaders @MariaBelenPower and @MlsScammell and Chelsea City Councilor @DamaliVidot to talk about the severity of the COVID-19 crisis in Chelsea. Help by donating to the One Chelsea Fund today at https://t.co/S6rWfl5m93. https://t.co/1f1Nv7QBIX

Environmental injustices have contributed to the severity of the COVID-19 crisis. Environmental justice must be a part of our recovery. Join us tomorrow as we discuss how environmental activism can help Chelsea address the impacts of this pandemic. https://t.co/i7lV0v3VSt
Join me and Mayor Dan Rivera live to discuss the impact that the coronavirus pandemic is having in Lawrence and what @danrivera01843 is doing to respond. https://t.co/LXJn0tiR6y

This pandemic is exacerbating long-standing inequalities in our country. For gateway cities like Lawrence the impacts of the pandemic are felt especially hard. Join me and Mayor @danrivera01843 today to talk about how the city is battling the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/e3rHWl25um

I am live now with @ChelseaCollab Executive Director Gladys Vega to visit their food pantry and discuss the disproportionate impact of the coronavirus pandemic on Chelsea. Help families in Chelsea: https://t.co/O3PbJzRk1d and htt https://t.co/ud6W3dWoKY
Chelsea Massachusetts is in a crisis. If you can please help protect families at the epicenter of this pandemic and donate to the @ChelseaCollab's COVID-19 response efforts. https://t.co/O3PbJzzJ9F

Chelsea is the coronavirus epicenter in Massachusetts. I'm going live with the @ChelseaCollab today to visit their food pantry and hear about what families in the city need during this crisis. https://t.co/bFWAkEi6YW

Generations of systemic racism mean that communities of color are disproportionately impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. We must use all tools and information at our disposal to ensure that we correct this injustice and ensure Black and Brown families receive equitable care. https://t.co/TXXekMeq2i

First responders are on the front lines of this pandemic. We need a plan to keep them and their families safe if they contract COVID-19. I applaud the Hampden County Sheriff’s Department for opening the First Responder Recovery Home to care for frontline workers with COVID-19. https://t.co/QW7KZimkH2

COVID-19 is disproportionately harming communities of color and exposing generations of systemic racism. We need to collect racial and ethnic data for coronavirus testing and treatment so we can address these health disparities and begin rectifying decades of injustice.

Navigating the stress and uncertainty of the coronavirus pandemic is challenging for all of us. Join State Rep. @TamiGouveiaMA Dr. Michael Goldberg (@behaviorhealth) and me as we talk about how to care for your mental health during this crisis. https://t.co/MSIv1PIE2I

The coronavirus pandemic is putting a spotlight on systemic racism in our country. In the latest episode of #MarkeyOnTheMic  @RepLizMiranda and I discuss how historic disparities are exacerbated by this crisis. Listen at https://t.co/81zUG7k0fx.

We have seen the deadly consequences of ignoring science. Our response to the coronavirus must be based on medical expertise data and truth. We cannot allow Donald Trump to silence Dr. Fauci or anyone else.  https://t.co/t1NzGHqZ0Q

We need a national mobilization of our volunteer workforce to respond to the coronavirus pandemic and help those in need. That's why we must urgently expand AmeriCorps and double the pay of those who serve. https://t.co/NawBvaG3KW

The rise in racist anti-Asian sentiment during the coronavirus pandemic is unacceptable. Today I'll be talking to @SamuelJHyun about how we address this surge in intolerance in Massachusetts and across the country. #IamNotAVirus https://t.co/IDyYnvOTuv

We cannot leave a single person behind in this crisis. People who are incarcerated are facing far greater rates of COVID-19 infection and death than the general public. We must increase the use of compassionate release to reduce the prison population. https://t.co/sY6IrdQZ27

COVID-19 is disproportionately harming communities of color. That's why I joined @ewarren and @ayannapressley to demand that @CMSgov release data on COVID-19 testing and treatment by race and ethnicity. Transparency is key to combating disparities and ensuring equitable care.

Donald Trump is a pathological liar. He has risked countless lives by downplaying COVID-19 and failing to respond to this emergency. The president must use the Defense Production Act and #MakeTheMasks we need. https://t.co/2GUwOq6nnl
